medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute abdominal pain and constipation lasting over 48 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began acutely over 48 hours ago. Initially, the pain was centered around the umbilicus and rated ___; it is currently localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and rated ___ prior to medication. The pain is aggravated by movement and temporarily relieved by sleeping. After the onset of pain, the patient experienced nausea and non-bilious vomiting. The patient attributes partial lessening of pain to the relief of constipation with laxatives. The patient initially thought the pain might be related to food ingested at a party over the weekend.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Melanoma, hypotension, and 'disc problems'. Past surgical history includes excision of melanoma, two cesarean sections, and tonsillectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes skin cancers (squamous cell carcinoma and melanoma).
